title: Mark Poloncarz, Kevin Riford, Christina Little Riford Package - Erie County Rath Building

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Mark Poloncarz, Kevin Riford, Christina Little Riford Package - Erie County Rath Building
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.) Any and all records regarding the below April 2019 article published by WGRZ Ch. 2 News Buffalo regarding the 'suspicious' package dropped off at the Rath Building. 


https://www.wgrz.com/article/news/brother-and-sister-believe-package-that-caused-concern-for-poloncarz-came-from-them/71-df54a2b2-c826-4ca1-8634-64fdd6bd1c2d

In early April 2019, a brother and sister came forward believing that a suspicious package delivered to Erie County Executive Mark Poloncarz’s office in mid-March may have originated from them. The package, addressed personally and marked “urgent” without a return address, triggered alarm at the office and ultimately led Poloncarz to adopt an armed security detail. The sibling duo—Christina Little and Kevin Riford—say the envelope contained extensive documentation concerning a contentious custody dispute and allegations of judicial corruption in Niagara County. They hoped Poloncarz would either take action or forward their concerns to Governor Cuomo. After passing routine security screening, the package was delivered to a receptionist on the 16th floor of the Rath Building, along with similar documents sent to local media outlets.  Shortly afterward, a sheriff’s investigator visited Christina’s home seeking Kevin. The siblings were confused by the level of concern raised over what appeared to them to be harmless legal documents. Poloncarz later confirmed the package played a part in increasing security measures, though he did not personally read the contents—his staff reviewed it after authorities cleared it as non-dangerous

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The Riford Family

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FBI files pertaining to Johann "Jack" Unterweger (16 August 1950  – 29 June 1994), who was an Austrian serial killer who committed at least twelve murders in Austria, West Germany, Czechoslovakia and the United States. Unterweger was under FBI surveillance circa 1992, when he fled Austria to Miami, where he was arrested on Feb 27, 1992.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Unterweger

Please search first for any prior releases and/or pre-processed files, and release them on a rolling basis before processing any new material generated by this request. 

If no prior releases are available, please kindly conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, however as noted below, please inform me prior to performing any searches incurring fees.

communications.communication:
Dear Patrik Szigeti: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of District of Columbia. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 8/15/2025 and given the reference number R013995-081525 for tracking purposes. 
In all future correspondence regarding this request, please reference request number R013995-081525. You can monitor the progress of your request in the " My Records Center". 
 
The District of Columbia is required to respond to your FOIA request within fifteen (15) business days of its receipt.  See D.C. Official Code § 2-532(c)(2011).  However, under certain circumstances, D.C. Official Code § 2-532(d)(2011) authorizes the District to extend, by ten (10) additional days, the deadline by which it must respond to a FOIA request.  One of the circumstances provided by that statute is a case in which the District needs additional time to search for, collect and examine voluminous amounts of records and/or consult with an additional D.C. agency. 
For any questions regarding your request, please contact the FOIA office directly. Find the list of agency Open Government and FOIA contact information by visiting FOIA Contact Information. For ease of reference, we ask that you have your FOIA Reference Number available when you contact the FOIA office. 
Regards, 
District of Columbia

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Pretrial Detention Policies and Procedures
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Policies, Procedures, and Directives: All current written policies, procedures, directives, guidelines, or post orders regarding:
Pretrial detention of arrestees, including timing requirements for probable cause determinations
Bond setting eligibility, conditions, or procedures that differ for out-of-state versus in-state arrestees
Use of commercial surety bond companies
Release procedures and authorization protocols
Any policies governing the 48-hour constitutional detention limit
2: Training & Instruction – Any training materials, handouts, slide decks, manuals, or written instructions provided to jail staff regarding:
Constitutional detention limits and probable cause requirements
Bond procedures for non-resident arrestees
3: Communications – Any memoranda, directives, or internal communications (including emails or bulletins) regarding bond procedures for non-resident arrestees.
4: Contracts & Agreements – Any contracts, agreements, or fee arrangements currently in effect with commercial bonding companies.
5: Audit & Compliance Records – Any internal audit reports, inspection results, or compliance reviews regarding detention policies conducted within the past ten (10) years. 

These items are requested only to the extent they exist and are maintained in the normal course of business.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Whitley Accountabity Project

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: PC Determiniations 2023-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to probable cause determinations for warrantless arrests processed through Whitley County courts from January 1, 2023 through December 31, 2024:

1. Data Export: An electronic export (spreadsheet or CSV format) of all entries relating to probable cause determinations for warrantless arrests, containing the following fields (if maintained):
Case number / cause number
Defendant's full name
Defendant's city and state of residence (or last known address, with street number redacted if needed)
Date and time of arrest
Warrant-based or warrantless arrest indicator
Date and time of probable cause determination signed
Name and title of judicial officer who signed the probable cause determination
Scheduled date and time of initial hearing/appearance
Actual date and time initial hearing was conducted (if different from scheduled)
Bond type (surety, cash, recognizance, etc.)
Bond amount
Any notation or code indicating residency status (in-state vs. out-of-state)

2. Policy & Procedure Records: Any active or historical administrative orders, local court rules, or written policies governing:
Constitutional timeframes for probable cause determinations (including the 48-hour requirement)
Scheduling procedures and protocols for probable cause hearings
Weekend, holiday, and after-hours procedures for judicial determinations
Bail/bond conditions for out-of-state defendants
The use of commercial surety bonds vs. cash or recognizance bonds

3. Scheduling Records: Any logs, calendars, or records showing:
How probable cause hearings are scheduled and by whom
Standard scheduling practices for warrantless arrests
Any backlogs or delays in scheduling PC determinations
Judicial officer availability for probable cause determinations

4. Metadata or Data Dictionary: If the requested data fields are maintained under different names in your system, please provide a list of the field names and their definitions. If any requested field is not maintained, please identify which fields are unavailable.

These items are requested only to the extent they are recorded in the normal course of business.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Whitley Accountabity Project

title: Chemical and Biological Weapon Incidents within the United States

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all documents related to military personnel carrying out missions, responses, or other incidents involving chemical or biological weapons, substances, munitions, or agents within the United States of America, including all states and territories,  between January 1, 2005 and August 14, 2025. This includes incident requests from EODIMS on incidents involving such weapons or agents. 

I request that I be properly classified as a news media requester. I am an investigative researcher for Bellingcat, and I am requesting this information in that capacity and request that fees be waived for this request.

I am requesting expedited processing as I am a ”person primarily engaged in disseminating information” and there is urgency to inform the public about the activities of US military personnel, especially as it pertains to incidents involving chemical and biological agents that occur within the United States. 

Bellingcat is widely recognized for its reporting, and publishing regular features on issues of public interest and importance using open source material.

title: Information on DoE FOIA requests slated for cancellation (EXPEDITED)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Information on DoE FOIA requests slated for cancellation (EXPEDITED)
communications.communication:
Dear Department of Energy,

Please refer to https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/08/14/2025-15490/notice-of-the-department-of-energy-freedom-of-information-act-foia-still-interested-inquiry.

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records under the FOIA:
1. a CSV formatted spreadsheet of every "FOIA request to DOE HQ at any time prior to October 1, 2024 (FY25), that is still open and is not under active litigation with DOE (or another Federal agency)", including "FOIA requests submitted to another agency, which were transferred to DOE and provided with a DOE control number", and including requests which were not assigned a DoE control number

This spreadsheet should include the following data fields (to the extent they are available to the DoE):
a. all fields in or tracked by DoE's FOIA handling, processing, management, or other similar processes, software, or databases
b. whether or not a DoE control number was assigned
c. the requester's name, organization, and email
d. whether DoE considers the request to be "from [a] vexatious requester"
e. whether DoE considers the request to be "from [an] automated bot" 
f. all dates and actions related to the request (e.g. filing, acknowledgment, issuance of control number, inter agency transfer, initiation of search, individual notification to requester of https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/08/14/2025-15490/notice-of-the-department-of-energy-freedom-of-information-act-foia-still-interested-inquiry, individual notification to requester of any other "still interested" letter, responses in either direction, etc) 
g. track(s) and flag(s) of request (e.g. simple, complex, expedited, commercial, journalistic, other, fee waiver status, etc)
h. content of the request
i. subject line of the request
j. all FOIA control numbers assigned, including ones assigned other than by DoE
k. all URLs associated with the request (as request), such as a MuckRock or other request page, a FOIA portal page, or the like

2. all records that informed the creation of, and decisions embodied in, https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/08/14/2025-15490/notice-of-the-department-of-energy-freedom-of-information-act-foia-still-interested-inquiry (including, for instance, the decisions to give a 1 month deadline, and to make the notification by Federal Register publication rather than directly to requesters)

3. the specific subsection(s) of 5 USC 552, any other law, any regulation, and any court decision, which authorize DoE to in any way fail to respond to a request for which the requester 
a. does not respond to an individualized "still interested" letter
b. does not respond to https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/08/14/2025-15490/notice-of-the-department-of-energy-freedom-of-information-act-foia-still-interested-inquiry 

Please note that item 3 requests that you provide the relevant specific subsection, regulation, or decision; those are records that are not legally privileged. 

Please also note that the publication of https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/08/14/2025-15490/notice-of-the-department-of-energy-freedom-of-information-act-foia-still-interested-inquiry makes both items 2 & 3 post-decisional, and that they include "facts", which are exempt from deliberative process privilege.

For all responsive records, I request:
a. all parts of the record (i.e. no portion of a record with some responsive portion may be considered "non-responsive")
b. all record metadata, such as dates on which they were drafted, passed, went into effect, withdrawn, or similar events; person(s) / office(s) responsible; authors; IDs; revision numbers; email headers; hyperlinks; structural metadata; email addresses; comments; revision history; timestamps; file names and contents; pagination or lack thereof; format specific metadata (e.g. particular to Word, PDF, or paper files); filing location, labeling, & organization; etc.
c. if any classification applies, mandatory declassification review (MDR) under E.O. 13526, and the result of the MDR, including any declassified records.


# Form & format

## Native email format & minimal redaction

Please provide all email records in EML, Maildir, or MBOX format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide all other records in their original electronic format (if electronic), and as one 300dpi color scan PDF per logical document, staple, paperclip, or file folder (whichever is most narrow) if the original is in paper format.

Please note that FOIA requires you to service the maximum extent of my request that can be done via e.g. partial redaction of exempt material. If you believe some portions of a record to be exempt because it contains classified information (18 USC 798), please provide a version of the record redacted to the minimum extent necessary to remove exempt information, along with adequate information to describe the reason for each specific exemption, and without altering any non exempt information (including metadata).

## No new records; electronic & original format

This request does not ask you to create new records.

If you determine that a response would require creating a new record that you do not want to create, please first contact me by email with an explanation of what records you have that would most closely match the information requested and might be acceptable substitutes, so that we can reasonably tailor the request.

In particular, I specifically request that you do not create new documents in response to this request that are modifications of a digital record, such as page-view images, print views, scans, or the like. No such creation or substitution is authorized by FOIA.

However, if the same or similar records are held in both electronic and paper formats, this request includes both the paper and electronic versions. The paper version and the digital version are distinct records, and each may contain distinct information such as handwritten or other markings on the paper copy and embedded metadata in the electronic version. I specifically request both the original, electronic format record, and (if it contains any additional markings) the paper record.

To the extent that the original native electronic format is proprietary or otherwise not in format accessible by widely available, open source software, I also request
1. an export of the proprietary format into a standard, open format, and
2. all proprietary software and documentation necessary to use and understand the original, proprietary format records.

## Rehab Act § 508 compliance

I am partially blind. In accordance with 5 USC 552(a)(3)(B & C) (E-FOIA), Rehabilitation Act § 508, and the FOIA Improvement Act, I require that you respond using original, native format, electronic, machine-processable, accessible, open, and well structured records to the maximum extent possible — for both the content of your response, and any communications about the request (such as response letters).

Please make all correspondence pursuant to this request — including notification and responsive records — by email, with native electronic format records, as specified in the request. I do not authorize you to send anything to me by physical mail unless I specifically state otherwise.

## Compression, passwords, and uploading large files

Multiple files may be sent in a combined, compressed form using standard ZIP, TAR, GZIP, BZIP2, and/or RAR formats, or sent as separate files, at your discretion.

Do not use any password on any files, including ZIP files etc., unless a password was present in the original, native format (in which case, leave it unaltered, and send me the password). Do not respond using ZixCorp "Secure Mail" or any other method that "expires" records from being available. Use only actual email and direct attachments, or upload using the link below, unless I explicitly request otherwise.

If there are any files you prefer not to transfer by email (e.g. if they are >10MB), please upload them to me via the link listed below my signature. Doing so is secure, completely free to you, and I will be notified of the upload. If that is insufficient, I can also provide Google Drive, Dropbox, SFTP, rsync, or similar provisions that will let you easily upload hundreds of gigabytes of data to me for free.

## Redaction format 

When redacting any content, please assign a replacement identifier for each different piece of content redacted, so that your redaction does not obfuscate the commonality.

For example, suppose that responsive records include the names Alice, Bob, and Chris, and you determine that each of those names are redactable (e.g. under (b)(7) or (b)(6)). Rather than redacting each with only the text "(b)(7)(C)", replace each instance of "Alice" with "(b)(7)(D) - confidential source 1", each instance of "Bob" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 2", each instance of "Chris" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 3",  etc. This would vindicate your narrow interest in withholding the person's identity, while not withholding the facts of commonality between occurrences, nor the relevant natures of each redacted person, which you would not have justification to withhold.

Please use reasonably descriptive identifiers. For instance, if Alice's name is not redacted but her personal cellphone number is, and that cellphone number appears e.g. both in her email signature and elsewhere by itself, it should in both cases be redacted with the same descriptive identifier, such as "Alice's cell #" (or "confidential source 1's cell #" if her name is redacted, as above). 

Please use a unique replacement identifier number for each distinct item — e.g. even if you only redact two entities, and they have different descriptors such that the descriptors would distinguish them, use "confidential source 1" and "US congressional aide 2", not "US congressional aide 1". The result should be that there is exactly one replacement identifier number per identical redacted content, across all records produced, with no reuse of the same number for different content, nor use of different numbers for the same content — except for the purposes of descriptive reference, e.g. the "2" in "confidential source 1 email to US congressional aide 2".

If a classification codeword is itself classified — meaning very specifically the text of that codeword, e.g. if the literal texts "STLW" and/or "STELLARWIND" were themselves classified, not merely their expansions, referents, or covered records —  please use a replacement like "TSC 4" or "SC 5" (as applicable). Likewise, if the existence of a particular classification authority office is classified, please use a replacement like "NSA office 6". Etc.

For PDFs, replacement identifiers can be specified in the margins if they don't fit in the original space. For more native electronic files, like EML, this can be done by direct editing. If space or file format does not permit you to do so inline or in margins or equivalent, then please use just the replacement identifier number (e.g. "[#52]"), and provide a CSV formatted table matching replacement identifier numbers to full replacement identifiers with your response letter.

If you make any such redactions, please keep but do not provide a table matching codes/identifiers to the redacted content, for use in case your redaction is examined or overturned on appeal or in litigation.

This is a form and format request pertaining to your process of redaction. Because it only applies in situations when you have already exercised the voluntary decision to alter the records from the original form requested, you have necessarily waived any objection to this section "creating a new record", since your act of redaction itself already "makes a new record" in that limited sense. This is only about how you do a redaction you have already decided to make.

This provision limits the scope of your redaction to the minimum possible extent, and specifies the form and format of your redactions, so that even if you decide to withhold some particular piece of content, you do not also withhold the fact of its being the same as the same content appearing elsewhere, or the kind of thing redacted. That fact is itself metadata that is explicitly requested as part of this request. If you decide that the mere fact of two pieces of content being the same is itself withholdable, then please redact it using a replacement identifier that encodes only the reason.


# Rolling updates

Please provide me with rolling (incremental) updates, rather than having the entirety of the request be blocked until fully completed.

Please preserve all responsive records that you currently hold, pending release, particularly ones that are currently held in electronic form or format.

Please prioritize rolling updates based on what is most readily available, i.e. such that you release as the greatest amount of records in the fastest time.


# Fee waiver

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial, journalistic purposes;
* I am requesting records to be provided exclusively in electronic format, with no paper copies, so you should incur no actual costs; and
* the DoE has incorporated these records, by reference, in a Federal Register publication, https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/08/14/2025-15490/notice-of-the-department-of-energy-freedom-of-information-act-foia-still-interested-inquiry; 
* these records would inform the public about a novel attempt to cancel FOIA requests in bulk; and
* these records would better enable responses to the DoE's Federal Register publication.


# Expedition

I request expedited processing, to be completed in no longer than 2 weeks, because these records are critical to 
a. informing responses to the DoE's Federal Register publication, which demands a response by September 18, 2025, and
b. informing timely journalistic coverage of that publication and its likely impact.

I also note that all records requested by item 1 should be already held by the DoE HQ FOIA office itself, making it especially easy to quicky provide.

Please pay particular attention to the "rolling updates" request above. In order to maximally expedite this request, please provide every record (or part of record) requested as soon as you are able, on the same day as that particular record can be provided, without waiting for any remaining records requested, even if that makes the records fragmented, or makes any particular update incomplete. This includes, for example, providing CSV formatted spreadsheets in response to item 1 which cover only some of the sub-items (if for instance some of them can be more quickly provided than others). However, please ensure that every spreadsheet provided in response to item 1 includes at least 1 uniquely identifying field-set which is the same across all spreadsheets, so that partial responses can be easily combined to form a single updated spreadsheet. (Alternatively and preferably, provide successively updated spreadsheets with all information available so far, rather than just the unique identifiers and the newly available column(s).)


# Request tracking numbers and estimated completion date

Upon receipt, and in every followup response, please state your tracking number(s) for this request, as well as your specific estimated completion date. 5 USC 552(a)(7).


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your initial response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires for expedited requests.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.
Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt corporation devoted to public interest journalism, government transparency and accountability, individuals' civil rights, and related issues.

P.S. My full legal name is "Sai". Please use no title for me.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request relates to a stop, detention, and/or arrest on or about August 12, 2025. Portions of that incident are depicted here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B95YrAey3EM. Two of the officers involved are Colin Woolston and Jason Stramler. A third officer or employee, Michael Rea, appears to be present.

I request:

1. Any incident report, arrest report, or other narrative stemming from the stop or the officers' interactions with person(s) filming the stop or arrest.

2. Any video or audio recording made by body camera or vehicular-mounted camera during the stop, detention, or arrest.

3. Any video or audio recording made using the camera system operated by Michael during the stop, detention, or arrest.

4. Any policies concerning whether or when officers or employees of the Eugene Police Department may self-identify as "press."

5. Any policies concerning Eugene police officers' interactions with (a) members of the media or with (b) other members of the public filming.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

All outgoing, non-privileged recorded phone calls made by inmate Harley Rawson (Inmate ID A702673) between January 1, 2025, and March 1, 2025.

communications.subject: YOUR REQUEST HAS BEEN RECEIVED Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: SOR and Community Supervision
communications.communication:
The Colorado Department of Corrections is a criminal justice agency and, as such, requests will be reviewed and responded to in accordance with the Colorado Criminal Justice Records Act (C.R.S. 24-72-301 et.seq.) 
Requests received by the Records Custodian after 3 pm or any day that the Department of Corrections is officially closed will be considered received as of the next business day. Responses are typically provided within 7 business days of receipt (excluding weekends, holidays). If you have not received your response within 7 business days of receipt, please re-send your request so we can provide a status update. 
If the request is for medical records; the response time is 30 days once a signed HIPAA compliant release of information consent, and any other required documentation, has been received by the medical records technician or designee at the appropriate facility. 
Please note: The Department of Corrections may charge an hourly fee for the research, retrieval and preparation of records. The first hour of research, retrieval and preparation are without charge. Beyond the first hour, the fees may vary depending on the type of record and the discretion of the custodian but will not exceed $33 per hour. You will be advised in advance if your request will incur a fee. 
In addition to the research, retrieval and production fees, there is a .25 per page fee for paper copies. The per page fee is not charged for electronic documents, however, research, retrieval and production fees still apply. Any fees due are payable in advance. Responsive documents will not be produced until payment has been tendered. 
Fees may be waived by the Department on recommendation of the records custodian.

title: Clark County Court Administrator of the District Court Jury List Request

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to NV Rev Stat § 6.045(5)(c)(1)

The following materials regarding the compilation and composition of the state’s master jury list:

All current policies and procedures regarding how the current master jury list was compiled and how often master jury lists are reviewed and updated. Please name all source lists (driver’s license records, voter registration lists, etc) that were utilized in creating the current master jury list.

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding the composition of the current master jury list. Please include the total number of individuals on the current master jury list and all relevant demographic data, including but not limited to the race, age and gender of individuals that comprise the current master jury list.

In the event that there are any fees for obtaining or copying these records, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Should the fees exceed $100, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees as I am requesting the information on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how master jury lists are created. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.
If possible, please provide the requested documents electronically. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records. Further, if you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact me with information concerning when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption that justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within the timeframe required by the statute.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Elijah Salisbury

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

the same information as provided in NLRB-2023-001998, but with current data. To quote:

> I'm working on FOIA request NLRB-2023-001998 for "all non-exempt fields of the participant and participant_party tables from the NxGen case management system database."
> 
> NxGen designates participants to have one of four roles:
> 
> * Primary: This is usually the main address of the facility as designated on the charge or petition
> * Legal Rep: Legal representation for the primary participant
> * Additional Service: These are people who would be like a cc in letters, or it could be a secondary address for someone. For example: many union reps list their official business address as primary, and because they might be located in a remote area or working from home, they have a secondary address or home address listed as an additional service.
> * Notification: This are the national or international union headquarters. To become a notification, the organization has to file Form 4702 annually, and the notification party only receives a copy of the charge or petition.
> 
> Participants also have distinct roles: Employer, Union, Individual, and Union as an Employer.
> 
> NxGen further designates participants as: Charging Party, Charged Party/Respondent, Involved Party, Petitioner, Intervenor, Employer, and Amicus.
> 
> Instead of providing a dump of all the participants in the system, and in order to provide the most relevant case information, my recommendation for participants is to provide the Primary participant information (entity name and address) and exclude the Legal Reps, Additional Services, and Notifications. Also, because the participant tables do not contain any other case-specific information besides the case number, I would recommend including the case name, date filed, date closed, and case closing reason. I also recommend information for individual charging parties/petitioners be listed simply as the party type of "Individual" and to exclude individuals' personal address information from your request (we would withheld it per Exemptions 6 and 7(C) if it's not specifically excluded.) Further, I would also recommend excluding Amicus information since cases can only have Amicus filings if the Board approves it.

title: 2025 Kings County DA Email Retention Policies

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: 2025 Kings County DA Email Retention Policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show the Kings County District Attorney's Office general retention schedule of records, the records inventory worksheet, and documentation describing policies and practices followed by the District Attorney's office on performing email searches and record redaction. These documents include, but are not limited to:

1. The District Attorney's Office general retention period for records, including but not limited to emails, 
2. The District Attorney's Office current policies and guidelines related to records management, retention, and disposition
3. The current, complete Master Records Schedule for the District Attorney's Office, or equivalent master index of records
4. The most recent version of California State form STD. 70 (Records Inventory Worksheet) for the District Attorney's Office, or equivalent records
5. The current Department Retention File plan for the District Attorney's Office, or equivalent records, such as the Departmental Records Retention Schedule or other relevant documents
6. Records that describe how the DA's office performs email searches when searching for public records. These records may include, but are not limited to, technical manuals or vendor documentation describing the kinds of keyword searches can be performed, especially advanced or "boolean" searches
7. Records which describe the technical limitations of the aforementioned system(s) for searching emails when it comes to searching and exporting results, such as the maximum number of records that can be exported for a single search and the maximum file size that can be exported for a single search
8. Records describing the processes and tools used by the DA's office to redact sensitive information before returning records. This request does not cover policy documents explaining the legal bases for redacting; only the records that explain HOW redaction is carried out.

For numbered items 7, 8, and 9, please include, without limitation, technical manuals, vendor documentation, trainings, FAQs, and tutorials.

For reference, I have attached responses from the Los Angeles County District Attorney, San Francisco County District Attorney, and Alpine County District Attorney to California Public Records Act requests for similar documents. These include the following documents listed below:

1. Los Angeles District Attorney Office Departmental Records Retention Schedule (DRRS), file name: "los_angeles_county_dao_drrs.pdf"
2. San Francisco District Attorney's Office Record Retention and Destruction Policy, file name: "san_francisco_dao_record_retention_policy.pdf"
3. Alpine County District Attorney's Office correspondence with MuckRock News on March 9, 2023 responding to Public Records Act request, file name: "03_09_2023_alpine_county_dao_request_response.pdf"

Please note that the California Public Records Act allows a member of the public to request records by describing their content, rather than asking for specific documents by name; an agency that receives such a request must “search for records based on criteria set forth in the search request.” CFAC, 67 Cal. App. 4th at 165-66.

Please let me know should there be any clarification or assistance I can provide to in order to "make a focused and effective request that reasonably describes an identifiable record or records" (Gov. Code §7922.600).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Doe

title: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2025) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2025

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2025) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2025
communications.communication:
08-14-2025

LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2025) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2025

Via email: PublicRecordsRequest@lwsd.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2025 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2025.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip or digital compression in each installment for the fewest number of total records and the most economical calculation of any applicable public records fees.

USE OF PORTAL NOT MANDATORY - DIRECTING REQUESTORS TO THIRD-PARTY LINKS VIOLATES ACCESS RIGHTS

Third-party portals often require creating an account or logging in, restrict downloads or viewing times, and remove or disable links after a short period of time.

These restrictions unlawfully condition access to public records and are inconsistent with RCW 42.56.080 and RCW 42.56.550.

Because of this, Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA.com) for  public records requests is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation or NEXT-REQUEST.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, or NEXT-REQUEST.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

communications.communication:

Lake Washington School District - JUSTFOIA Software Purchase, Installation, Configuration, Integration, Administration (08/2025)

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

To whom it may concern,

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

Pursuant to Washington’s Public Records Act (PRA), RCW 42.56, I request inspection and electronic copies of all records and writings (as those terms are defined in RCW 42.56.010) relating to Lake Washington School District’s purchase, installation, configuration, integration, administration, and use of the JustFOIA public records software platform (a CivicPlus company), including any related CivicPlus components or services.

Timeframe

Please search from January 1, 2015 to the present, or the earliest date responsive records exist, whichever is broader.

Definitions, scope, and preservation

“Records” and “writings” include all formats: emails, texts/iMessages, chats (Teams/Slack/Google Chat), letters, notes, photos, spreadsheets, databases, calendars, audio/video, PDFs, logs, dashboards, data exports, screen captures, configuration files, source or script files, API payloads, and associated metadata (system, header, and audit metadata). See RCW 42.56.010; O’Neill v. City of Shoreline (metadata is a public record).

Personal accounts/devices used for public business are in scope (e.g., texts or emails about JustFOIA). See Nissen v. Pierce County.

Please immediately preserve potentially responsive ESI in all repositories (email, Teams/Slack, SharePoint/OneDrive/Google Drive, file servers, ticketing, finance/procurement, security tools, and the JustFOIA system itself). Do not delete, overwrite, or recycle logs or backups potentially responsive to this request.

Production & delivery preferences (electronic, native, no portal)

Provide records electronically in native format with metadata intact (e.g., PST/MBOX for email; XLSX/CSV for spreadsheets/data; JSON/CSV/XML for exports; MSG/EML with attachments; original images/videos). Do not print electronic records to PDF unless the original is PDF.

Delivery: Please do not use the JustFOIA portal for this request. Send by direct email attachments, or direct, publicly accessible download links (no login or registration). If size is an issue, use a standard file-transfer link accessible without creating an account.

If any portion is withheld or redacted, provide a specific exemption log stating the statutory basis and a brief explanation (RCW 42.56.210(3)).

If you believe any item is not “reasonably locatable,” please describe the systems searched, custodians, date ranges, and search terms used, and identify systems not searched and why.

Repositories and custodians to search (non-exhaustive)

Custodians: Public Records Office; Legal/General Counsel/Risk; IT leadership and admins; Enterprise Apps; Information Security; Infrastructure/Network; Procurement/Purchasing; Finance/AP; Communications; Superintendent’s Office; any project managers, analysts, or staff assigned to PRA or JustFOIA; any contractors/consultants who implemented or support JustFOIA.

Systems: Microsoft 365/Exchange/Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive; Slack (if used); ticketing/ITSM (e.g., ServiceNow, Freshservice, Zendesk, Jira, Spiceworks); procurement/ERP/finance/AP; identity/SSO (Azure AD/Entra ID, Okta, ADFS); log management/SIEM; backup/archival; and the JustFOIA production and test/sandbox environments.

Search terms (minimum baseline; add equivalents & abbreviations)

“JustFOIA” OR “Just FOIA” OR “Just-FOIA”

“CivicPlus” OR “Civic Plus”

Contract numbers, RFP/PO numbers related to the platform

“PRA software”, “public records system”, “records portal”, “request portal”, “redaction tool”

“implementation”, “migration”, “configuration”, “SSO”, “integration”, “API”, “export”, “retention”, “audit log”, “training”, “UAT”, “go-live”, “outage”, “incident”, “breach”, “security”, “SOC 2”

Requested record categories (A–Z)

Please produce all records and writings responsive to each category. If a record falls into multiple categories, one copy is sufficient.

A. Procurement & selection
Needs assessments, market scans, vendor demos, ROI/benefit analyses, budget justifications, sole-source justifications, RFIs/RFQs/RFPs, Q&A, vendor responses, evaluation criteria, scoring sheets, selection memos, recommendation approvals, board materials, and decision emails.

B. Contracts & legal
All agreements with CivicPlus/JustFOIA and related vendors (master agreements, order forms, statements of work, addenda, DPAs/BAAs, SLAs/uptime, support/maintenance, data residency, subcontractors), standard terms, non-disclosure agreements, termination/exit clauses, and notices of assignment or subcontracting.

C. Financials
Funding approvals, POs, requisitions, quotes, pricing sheets, invoices, credit memos, payment records, account statements, and any grant paperwork tied to the purchase.

D. Implementation project
Project charters, plans, schedules, task trackers, risk/issue logs, change requests, cut-over plans, acceptance criteria, UAT scripts/results, go-live approvals, post-implementation reviews, and internal status reports.

E. Architecture & integrations
System/network diagrams; integration designs with email, M365/SharePoint/OneDrive, imaging/scanning, archives, and ticketing; API usage docs; SSO/SAML/OAuth/OpenID configuration guides; data flow maps and data dictionaries.

F. Security & privacy
Security/privacy assessments (DPIA/PIA), vendor questionnaires, risk acceptance memos, encryption/Key management details (as held by LWSD), vulnerability/penetration summaries, SOC 2/ISO certificates in LWSD’s possession, incident/outage/breach notices, and any security advisories received from CivicPlus.

G. Policies & procedures
Current and historical policies/SOPs/workflows for handling PRA requests in JustFOIA (intake, search, review, redaction, exemption application, installment production, appeal/closure), including redaction and exemption templates.

H. Training & user guidance
Training decks, handouts, recordings, internal “how-to” guides, quick-reference materials, and vendor-provided manuals kept by LWSD.

I. Configuration & administration
Tenant/instance settings, retention rules, routing rules/queues, templates, redaction presets, exemption code lists, custom fields, tags, roles/permissions matrices, SSO/IdP mappings, and automation rules (including any scripts).

J. Users & access
User/account lists (names may be redacted as necessary), roles, group assignments, provisioning/deprovisioning records, MFA/SSO enrollment logs, and audit trails of admin actions.

K. Logs (system & audit)
Access logs, authentication logs, admin logs, change/config logs, export/download logs, redaction activity logs, deletion/closure logs, error/outage logs, and any API call logs.

L. Data & schema
Field lists, data models, table layouts, picklist values, and sample exports (with sensitive requester content redacted if necessary) showing how LWSD data is stored.

M. Usage & performance
Reports/dashboards on request volumes, processing times, backlog, installment counts, on-time percentage, appeal/closure stats, and any KPI summaries provided by the system or vendor.

N. Communications with vendor(s)
All emails/chats/letters/meeting notes between LWSD and CivicPlus/JustFOIA (sales, implementation, support, account management, renewals, outages, feature requests, compliance/legal).

O. Internal communications
Emails/chats/notes among LWSD personnel referencing JustFOIA/CivicPlus and the system’s selection, rollout, configuration, operations, outages, performance, redaction/exemptions, retention, or reporting.

P. Support & tickets
IT tickets, vendor cases, bug reports, feature requests, troubleshooting notes, escalation records, and resolutions.

Q. Web & public-facing
Website pages, announcements, instructions to requesters about using/not using the portal, and any accessibility or usability testing results.

R. Retention, backup, & archival
Records describing backups/snapshots, retention/disposition schedules, export procedures, and any migrations into or out of JustFOIA.

S. Migration/transition
Records of data migration from prior systems into JustFOIA, or from JustFOIA to any successor platform, including mapping documents and validation results.

T. Legal holds & litigation
Notices of hold involving JustFOIA data, instructions to staff, and any litigation/appeal materials referencing the system’s records.

U. Accessibility & equity
ADA/Section 508 evaluations, language access accommodations in the system, and related compliance assessments.

V. Third-party notifications
Any notifications to third parties about disclosure of their information from JustFOIA, including templates used.

W. Testing/sandbox
Existence and use of staging/sandbox environments; test plans and test data handling policies.

X. Change management
Change approval records (CAB), release notes maintained by LWSD, version/feature enablement decisions.

Y. Termination/exit
If applicable, records regarding contract non-renewal, termination, or exit planning, including data return/deletion certificates.

Z. Delivery method for this request
Any internal records discussing or directing that JustFOIA should not be used to deliver records for this specific request, and the alternative delivery steps adopted.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. These restrictions unlawfully condition access to public records and are inconsistent with RCW 42.56.080 and RCW 42.56.550.

Because of this, Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA.com) for  public records requests is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Delivery: Send via direct email attachment or direct, public download link — do not require portal login or registration.

Provide an exemption log for any withheld/redacted records (RCW 42.56.210(3)).

Systems: Microsoft 365/Exchange/Teams/SharePoint/OneDrive, Google Workspace, email archives/journaling, log management/SIEM, ticketing/ITSM, file servers, imaging/scanning, cloud storage, prior eDiscovery tools.

Search terms (minimum baseline):

“eDiscovery”, “e-discovery”, “ediscovery”

“Microsoft Purview”, “Advanced eDiscovery”, “Content Search”, “Core eDiscovery”, “Security & Compliance Center”

“Google Vault”

“Relativity”, “Everlaw”, “Logikcull”, “Exterro”, “Nuix”, “Casepoint”, “Zapproved”, “OpenText”, “EnCase”, “Nextpoint”, “Concordance”, “Clearwell”

“litigation hold”, “legal hold”, “custodian search”, “document review”, “ESI processing”, “PST export”

Contract/RFP/PO numbers related to any eDiscovery platform

Requested record categories (A–Z):

A. Procurement & selection – Needs assessments, vendor comparisons, demos, RFIs/RFQs/RFPs, Q&A, evaluation scores, board approval, and decision memos.

B. Contracts & legal – All agreements with eDiscovery vendors, SLAs, DPAs, security addenda, subcontractor notices.

G. Policies & procedures – SOPs for search, review, tagging, redaction, production; chain-of-custody processes; export/transfer guidelines.

H. Training & user guidance – Training decks, manuals, quick-reference sheets, internal guides.

I. Configuration & administration – Retention rules, search indexes, roles/permissions, tagging schemas, redaction presets, data source lists.

J. Users & access – User lists, role assignments, provisioning/deprovisioning logs, MFA/SSO logs.

K. Logs (system & audit) – Search logs, export logs, login/access logs, chain-of-custody logs, error/outage logs.

L. Data & schema – Field lists, index structures, data models, sample exports (redacted if necessary).

M. Usage & performance – Reports/dashboards on searches, review volumes, case counts, processing times.

N. Communications with vendor(s) – All correspondence about procurement, implementation, support, upgrades, feature requests, outages.

O. Internal communications – Staff discussions on system use, search strategies, redaction policies, production decisions.

P. Support & tickets – Vendor and internal support tickets, bug reports, feature requests.

Q. Web & public-facing – Any public instructions or disclosures about LWSD’s eDiscovery tools.

R. Retention, backup, & archival – Backup policies, archival schedules, export procedures, migration plans.

S. Migration/transition – Moves from prior systems to current or future eDiscovery platforms.

T. Legal holds & litigation – Hold notices, custodian lists, compliance tracking, release notices.

U. Accessibility & equity – ADA/Section 508 compliance for review portals.

V. Third-party notifications – Notices to data subjects or third parties about disclosures.

W. Testing/sandbox – Test environment records, handling of test data.

X. Change management – CAB approvals, release notes, change logs.

Y. Termination/exit – Data export, return/destruction certificates, exit strategy records.

Z. Delivery method for this request – Internal decisions about how eDiscovery records are produced in response to PRA requests.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip or digital compression in each installment for the fewest number of total records and the most economical calculation of any applicable public records fees.

USE OF PORTAL NOT MANDATORY - DIRECTING REQUESTORS TO THIRD-PARTY LINKS VIOLATES ACCESS RIGHTS

Third-party portals often require creating an account or logging in, restrict downloads or viewing times, and remove or disable links after a short period of time.

These restrictions unlawfully condition access to public records and are inconsistent with RCW 42.56.080 and RCW 42.56.550.

Because of this, Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA.com) for  public records requests is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation or NEXT-REQUEST.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, or NEXT-REQUEST.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

title: April R. Martz, Associate Director of Compliance Investigations - Lake Washington School District - OSPI Records - (08/2025)

communications.communication:
April R. Martz, Associate Director of Compliance Investigations - Lake Washington School District - OSPI Records - (08/2025)

August 13, 2025

Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction
Attn: Public Records Office

Via email:  PublicRecordsRequest@k12.wa.us

Public Records Act Request  

Dear Public Records Officer:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, RCW 42.56, I request copies (in native or PDF format) of all public records held by your agency relating to the following Lake Washington School District employee:

April R. Martz, Associate Director of Compliance Investigations - Lake Washington School District

April Ruth Martz
aka
April Ruth Philley
8209 NE 169th St, Kenmore, WA 98028
DOB: August 25, 1990
Washington State Bar No. 56812
(214) 673-0556
(214) 850-0011
arphilley@gmail.com
april.martz@axiomlaw.com
rsphilley@sbcglobal.net

Responsive public records include, but are not limited to, the following categories:

1. Certification & Licensing Records

(Required disclosure: RCW 42.56.070(1); *Belenski v. Jefferson County*, 186 Wn.2d 452 (2016))

* Certificate type(s), endorsement(s), and specialties
* Issuance and expiration dates
* Renewal history
* Status (active, expired, revoked, suspended)
* Revocation/suspension orders or findings
* Professional education permits
* OSPI credential verification and related records

 2. Employment History & Job-Related Information

(Required disclosure: RCW 42.56.070(1); *Predisik v. Spokane School Dist. No. 81*, 182 Wn.2d 896 (2015))

* Job titles and positions held
* Dates of employment and assignment locations
* Salary placement and pay history
* Work-related training records, workshops, and continuing education completed
* Performance evaluations (with student identifiers redacted per RCW 42.56.230 & FERPA)

3. Disciplinary Records

(Required disclosure: RCW 42.56.070(1); *Spokane Police Guild v. Liquor Control Bd.*, 112 Wn. App. 467 (2002))

* Final disciplinary decisions and findings
* Written reprimands, letters of censure, and settlement agreements
* Revocation/suspension letters from OSPI’s Office of Professional Practices
* Findings of unprofessional conduct

4. Application & Appointment Records

* Completed certification and endorsement applications
* Renewal forms and supporting documentation
* Hiring applications, resumes, and cover letters (with personal contact info redacted per RCW 42.56.250(1))
* Interview scoring or selection records (post-hiring)

 5. Sexual Misconduct Disclosure Release Forms

(Required under RCW 28A.400.303)

* Completed forms, with only the following redactions permitted:
  * SSNs, DOBs, driver’s license numbers (RCW 42.56.230(5) & RCW 42.56.250(8))
  * Personal contact info of references (RCW 42.56.250(1))

 6. Complaints & Investigations

* Complaints, investigation reports, and witness statements (with student names redacted per FERPA and RCW 42.56.230)
* Correspondence related to investigations


7. Training & Professional Development

* Clock hour records and transcripts of district/OSPI-sponsored training
* Specialty program certifications (e.g., safety, bilingual, special education endorsements)


8. Financial & Contractual Records

* Employment contracts, supplemental pay agreements, and stipend contracts
* Expense reimbursements and travel claims related to official duties
